official-title.#text:
To amend the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act to eliminate benefits under the Federal
			 Employees Health Benefits Program for Members of Congress so they are
			 treated the same way as other taxpayers, and for other purposes.

text.#text: The purpose of this Act is to eliminate coverage of Members of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new clause:

header.#text: Eliminating FEHBP benefits for Members of Congress

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
on or after March 23, 2010, such an
			 individual in the status as such a Member (including as a former Member or
			 as a member of a family, former spouse, or survivor of such a Member or
			 former Member) is not eligible to obtain coverage under, or any Government
			 contribution towards the premium for, a health benefits plan under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
chapter
			 89 of title 5, United States Code

text.#text: In the case of an individual who serves as a Member of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
representing a Congressional district in a State or, in the case of a Senator,
			 representing a State may satisfy the minimum essential coverage
			 requirement of

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
(relating to
			 coverage in the individual market) only through enrollment in a health
			 plan offered through the Federal or State Exchange for residents of such
			 district or such State, respectively.

header.#text: Individual coverage through an Exchange plan

Elimination of FEHBP benefits with respect to Members serving on or after March 23, 2010;
